The Tennessee Center for Policy Research: TCPR) released a report claiming that Al Gore's Tennessee home uses over 20 times more energy than the average U.S. home. This report serves as evidence to verify the authenticity of the claim.
The Nashville Electric Service: NES) confirmed that Gore's mansion consumes more electricity every month than the average American household uses in an entire year. This data from a reliable source further supports the claim.
Gore: s combined electricity and natural gas bills for his Nashville estate in 2006 totaled nearly $30,000. The substantial amount spent on energy bills further validates the claim of his residence using considerably more energy than the average American home.
